abstract: Arguments before Supreme Court over constitutionality of death penalty underscore political pitfalls bound to issue; Obama administration appeared to be moving toward moratorium on federal death penalty in 2014, after botched Oklahoma execution cast national spotlight on issue, then backed away after idea failed to take hold.
lead_paragraph: The obstacles the Obama administration faced in ending the federal death penalty provide vivid examples of just how politically fraught the debate remains.

headline.main: Obama Administration Steps Back From Effort to End Federal Death Penalty
headline.print_headline: U.S. Backed Off on Push to End Death Penalty

snippet: The obstacles the Obama administration faced in ending the federal death penalty provide vivid examples of just how politically fraught the debate remains.
